prompts.title: Customer Journey Mapping Framework
prompts.prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are a customer experience designer with expertise in mapping customer journeys that reveal optimization opportunities and improve user satisfaction.

# OBJECTIVE #
Create comprehensive customer journey map for [CUSTOMER_SEGMENT] using [PRODUCT/SERVICE] to identify pain points, opportunities, and design improvements.

# STYLE #
Visual, detailed, and empathy-driven mapping that captures both rational and emotional customer experiences across all touchpoints.

# TONE #
Customer-centric, analytical, and insightful while maintaining practical focus on actionable improvements.

# AUDIENCE #
Product teams, UX designers, marketing, customer service, and leadership teams focused on customer experience optimization.

# RESPONSE #
Develop complete journey mapping framework including:

CUSTOMER PERSONA ANALYSIS:
- Detailed persona development
- Demographics and psychographics
- Goals and motivations
- Pain points and frustrations
- Behavioral patterns and preferences
- Technology comfort and usage
- Decision-making factors
- Emotional drivers and triggers

JOURNEY STAGES DEFINITION:
- Awareness and discovery phase
- Consideration and evaluation stage
- Purchase and onboarding process
- Usage and engagement period
- Support and service interactions
- Renewal and loyalty phase
- Advocacy and referral stage
- Offboarding and win-back scenarios

TOUCHPOINT MAPPING:
- Digital touchpoint identification
- Physical interaction points
- Human-to-human contacts
- Third-party touchpoints
- Indirect influence points
- Communication channels
- Self-service interactions
- Cross-channel experiences

EMOTION AND EXPERIENCE ANALYSIS:
- Emotional state tracking
- Satisfaction level measurement
- Effort and friction assessment
- Expectation vs reality gaps
- Moment of truth identification
- Delight opportunity spots
- Frustration and confusion points
- Trust and confidence factors

PAIN POINT IDENTIFICATION:
- Process friction and obstacles
- Information gaps and confusion
- Technology and usability issues
- Communication breakdowns
- Wait times and delays
- Quality and reliability problems
- Support and service gaps
- Expectation misalignment

OPPORTUNITY ASSESSMENT:
- Experience improvement potential
- Automation and efficiency gains
- Personalization opportunities
- Channel optimization possibilities
- Communication enhancement areas
- Self-service expansion options
- Proactive support implementations
- Loyalty and retention improvements

ACTION PLANNING:
- Priority ranking framework
- Quick win identification
- Long-term improvement roadmap
- Resource requirement assessment
- Implementation timeline
- Success metrics definition
- Ownership and accountability
- Cross-functional collaboration needs

MEASUREMENT FRAMEWORK:
- Customer satisfaction metrics
- Net Promoter Score tracking
- Customer Effort Score monitoring
- Journey completion rates
- Touchpoint performance indicators
- Emotional experience measures
- Business impact calculations
- Continuous improvement process

Include visualization templates, stakeholder workshop guides, and implementation roadmap.

project_management.description: Project planning, execution, and team coordination prompts

prompts.title: Comprehensive Project Plan Generator
prompts.prompt:
CONCISE: Create comprehensive project plan for [PROJECT_NAME] that delivers [PROJECT_OBJECTIVES] within [TIMELINE] and [BUDGET] constraints while managing risks and stakeholder expectations.

LOGICAL: Structure plan as: Project Charter → Scope Definition → Work Breakdown → Resource Planning → Timeline Development → Risk Management → Quality Assurance → Communication Strategy

EXPLICIT: Develop complete project plan including:

PROJECT CHARTER:
- Project purpose and business case
- Success criteria and objectives
- Scope and deliverable definition
- Stakeholder identification and roles
- Budget and resource allocation
- Timeline and milestone framework
- Constraints and assumptions
- Risk tolerance and mitigation approach

WORK BREAKDOWN STRUCTURE:
- Hierarchical task decomposition
- Deliverable-based organization
- Work package definitions
- Task dependency mapping
- Effort estimation methodology
- Resource requirement analysis
- Quality criteria specification
- Acceptance criteria definition

RESOURCE MANAGEMENT:
- Team structure and roles
- Skill requirement analysis
- Resource allocation planning
- Capacity and availability assessment
- Training and development needs
- Vendor and contractor management
- Equipment and tool requirements
- Budget distribution and tracking

SCHEDULE DEVELOPMENT:
- Critical path analysis
- Task sequencing and dependencies
- Milestone and checkpoint planning
- Buffer and contingency time
- Resource leveling and optimization
- Schedule compression techniques
- Progress tracking methodology
- Schedule change management

RISK MANAGEMENT:
- Risk identification and assessment
- Probability and impact analysis
- Risk mitigation strategies
- Contingency planning
- Risk monitoring and control
- Issue escalation procedures
- Change management process
- Quality assurance measures

COMMUNICATION PLAN:
- Stakeholder communication matrix
- Reporting frequency and format
- Meeting schedule and agendas
- Documentation and knowledge management
- Decision-making processes
- Conflict resolution procedures
- Progress reporting mechanisms
- Lessons learned capture

QUALITY MANAGEMENT:
- Quality standards and criteria
- Review and approval processes
- Testing and validation procedures
- Quality control checkpoints
- Defect prevention strategies
- Continuous improvement processes
- Customer satisfaction measurement
- Quality metrics and KPIs

PROJECT MONITORING:
- Performance measurement framework
- Earned value management
- Progress tracking and reporting
- Budget monitoring and control
- Schedule adherence assessment
- Quality metrics evaluation
- Risk and issue tracking
- Stakeholder satisfaction monitoring

ADAPTIVE: Customize approach for:
- Different project methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Hybrid)
- Various project sizes and complexities
- Different industries and domains
- Organizational maturity levels
- Cultural and geographical considerations

REFLECTIVE: Include project success evaluation criteria, lessons learned framework, knowledge transfer procedures, and continuous improvement mechanisms. Provide project closure and transition planning.

prompts.title: Agile Sprint Planning Framework
prompts.prompt:

prompts.title: Enterprise Risk Assessment Framework
prompts.prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are a risk management specialist with expertise in identifying, assessing, and mitigating enterprise-level risks across multiple business functions and operations.

# OBJECTIVE #
Conduct comprehensive risk assessment for [ORGANIZATION/PROJECT] to identify potential threats, assess impact and probability, and develop effective mitigation strategies.

# STYLE #
Systematic, quantitative approach with clear risk categorization, probability analysis, and actionable mitigation recommendations.

# TONE #
Objective, analytical, and professional while emphasizing practical risk management and business continuity.

# AUDIENCE #
Executive leadership, board members, risk committees, and operational managers responsible for risk mitigation and business continuity.

# RESPONSE #
Develop comprehensive risk assessment including:

RISK IDENTIFICATION:
- Strategic and business model risks
- Operational and process risks
- Financial and market risks
- Technology and cyber security risks
- Regulatory and compliance risks
- Reputational and brand risks
- Human capital and talent risks
- Environmental and sustainability risks

RISK ANALYSIS METHODOLOGY:
- Risk probability assessment (1-5 scale)
- Impact severity evaluation (1-5 scale)
- Risk exposure calculation (probability × impact)
- Velocity and timeline assessment
- Interconnected risk mapping
- Cascading effect analysis
- Historical precedent review
- Industry benchmark comparison

RISK CATEGORIZATION:
- High priority risks (immediate attention)
- Medium priority risks (planned mitigation)
- Low priority risks (monitoring required)
- Emerging risks (trend watching)
- Acceptable risks (within tolerance)
- Systemic risks (organization-wide impact)
- Operational risks (business function specific)
- External risks (market and environment)

MITIGATION STRATEGIES:
- Risk avoidance options
- Risk reduction techniques
- Risk transfer mechanisms
- Risk acceptance criteria
- Contingency planning approaches
- Business continuity measures
- Crisis response procedures
- Recovery and resilience planning

CONTROL IMPLEMENTATION:
- Preventive control measures
- Detective control systems
- Corrective action procedures
- Monitoring and surveillance systems
- Reporting and escalation protocols
- Review and update schedules
- Training and awareness programs
- Technology and tool deployment

RISK MONITORING:
- Key risk indicators (KRIs)
- Dashboard and reporting systems
- Regular assessment schedules
- Trend analysis and forecasting
- Early warning systems
- Stakeholder communication
- Performance measurement
- Continuous improvement processes

CRISIS MANAGEMENT:
- Crisis response team structure
- Communication protocols
- Decision-making procedures
- Resource allocation plans
- Stakeholder notification systems
- Media and public relations strategy
- Business continuity activation
- Recovery and restoration procedures

GOVERNANCE FRAMEWORK:
- Risk appetite and tolerance definition
- Roles and responsibilities matrix
- Risk committee structure
- Policy and procedure documentation
- Reporting and accountability systems
- Regulatory compliance alignment
- Board and executive oversight
- Third-party risk management

Include risk register templates, assessment tools, and governance documentation.

operations_management.description: Operational efficiency, process improvement, and supply chain management prompts

prompts.title: Process Improvement Analysis Framework
prompts.prompt:
CONCISE: Analyze and optimize [BUSINESS_PROCESS] to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance quality while maintaining compliance and customer satisfaction.

LOGICAL: Follow improvement methodology: Current State Analysis → Root Cause Analysis → Solution Design → Implementation Planning → Performance Measurement → Continuous Improvement

EXPLICIT: Conduct comprehensive process analysis including:

CURRENT STATE ASSESSMENT:
- Process mapping and documentation
- Flow analysis and bottleneck identification
- Time and motion studies
- Resource utilization assessment
- Quality and error rate analysis
- Cost and efficiency metrics
- Stakeholder and customer impact
- Technology and system evaluation

PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT:
- Key performance indicators (KPIs)
- Cycle time and throughput analysis
- Quality metrics and defect rates
- Cost per unit and resource efficiency
- Customer satisfaction scores
- Employee productivity measures
- Compliance and audit results
- Benchmark and best practice comparison

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
- Problem identification and categorization
- Fishbone diagram development
- 5 Whys analysis technique
- Statistical analysis and trending
- Process variation assessment
- System and technology limitations
- Human factor considerations
- Environmental and external factors

SOLUTION DEVELOPMENT:
- Process redesign options
- Automation and technology solutions
- Workflow optimization strategies
- Resource reallocation opportunities
- Training and skill development needs
- Policy and procedure updates
- System integration improvements
- Quality control enhancements

IMPROVEMENT PRIORITIZATION:
- Impact vs effort matrix
- Cost-benefit analysis
- Risk assessment and mitigation
- Implementation complexity evaluation
- Timeline and resource requirements
- Stakeholder buy-in assessment
- Change management considerations
- Quick win identification

IMPLEMENTATION PLANNING:
- Phased rollout strategy
- Change management approach
- Training and communication plan
- Resource allocation and scheduling
- Pilot testing and validation
- Risk mitigation measures
- Success criteria definition
- Monitoring and adjustment protocols

PERFORMANCE TRACKING:
- Before and after comparisons
- Real-time monitoring systems
- Variance analysis and reporting
- Continuous feedback mechanisms
- Exception handling procedures
- Trend analysis and forecasting
- Stakeholder satisfaction assessment
- ROI calculation and reporting

SUSTAINABILITY MEASURES:
- Process standardization
- Documentation and knowledge management
- Training and capability building
- Technology and tool deployment
- Governance and oversight systems
- Continuous improvement culture
- Innovation and adaptation mechanisms
- Best practice sharing and replication

ADAPTIVE: Customize approach for:
- Different process types and complexities
- Various organizational sizes and structures
- Different industries and regulatory environments
- Technology maturity and capability levels
- Change readiness and cultural factors

REFLECTIVE: Include lessons learned capture, success factor analysis, failure mode prevention, and scalability considerations. Provide framework for ongoing optimization and adaptation.

prompts.title: Supply Chain Optimization Strategy
prompts.prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are a supply chain expert with experience in optimizing end-to-end supply chain operations for improved efficiency, cost reduction, and risk mitigation.

# OBJECTIVE #
Optimize supply chain operations for [COMPANY] to reduce costs by [TARGET_PERCENTAGE]%, improve delivery performance, and enhance supply chain resilience.

# STYLE #
Data-driven, systematic approach with focus on measurable improvements and sustainable competitive advantage.

# TONE #
Analytical, strategic, and results-oriented while considering stakeholder impacts and implementation feasibility.

# AUDIENCE #
Supply chain leadership, operations teams, procurement, logistics, and executive stakeholders involved in supply chain decisions.

# RESPONSE #
Develop comprehensive supply chain optimization including:

SUPPLY CHAIN ANALYSIS:
- End-to-end value stream mapping
- Supplier performance assessment
- Inventory analysis and optimization
- Transportation and logistics evaluation
- Warehouse and distribution analysis
- Demand forecasting accuracy review
- Technology and system capabilities
- Cost structure and margin analysis

STRATEGIC SOURCING:
- Supplier segmentation and strategy
- Make vs buy analysis
- Global sourcing opportunities
- Supplier relationship management
- Contract negotiation optimization
- Risk diversification strategies
- Sustainability and ESG considerations
- Innovation and collaboration partnerships

INVENTORY OPTIMIZATION:
- Demand planning and forecasting
- Safety stock optimization
- ABC analysis and categorization
- Economic order quantity (EOQ) modeling
- Seasonal and trend adjustments
- Obsolescence and waste reduction
- Working capital optimization
- Service level target setting

LOGISTICS AND DISTRIBUTION:
- Network design optimization
- Transportation mode selection
- Route optimization and planning
- Warehouse layout and operations
- Last-mile delivery strategies
- Cross-docking and consolidation
- Reverse logistics and returns
- Sustainability and carbon footprint

TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION:
- Supply chain visibility platforms
- Demand planning and forecasting tools
- Inventory management systems
- Transportation management systems
- Warehouse management systems
- Supplier portal and collaboration
- Analytics and business intelligence
- Automation and robotics integration

RISK MANAGEMENT:
- Supply chain risk assessment
- Supplier financial stability monitoring
- Geographic and geopolitical risks
- Natural disaster and climate risks
- Cyber security and data protection
- Quality and compliance risks
- Business continuity planning
- Alternative sourcing strategies

PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT:
- Key performance indicators (KPIs)
- Cost metrics and benchmarking
- Service level measurements
- Quality and defect tracking
- Supplier scorecards and ratings
- Customer satisfaction metrics
- Sustainability and ESG reporting
- Continuous improvement tracking

IMPLEMENTATION ROADMAP:
- Priority initiative identification
- Phased implementation planning
- Resource allocation and budgeting
- Change management strategy
- Training and capability building
- Technology deployment timeline
- Pilot testing and validation
- Scaling and rollout procedures

Include cost-benefit analysis, risk mitigation plans, and supplier engagement strategies.

prompts.title: Innovation Strategy Development Framework

title: Comprehensive Market Analysis Framework
prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are a senior strategy consultant with expertise in [INDUSTRY] market analysis and 15+ years of experience working with Fortune 500 companies.

# OBJECTIVE #
Generate a comprehensive market analysis for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] that will inform strategic decision-making and investment planning.

# STYLE #
Professional, data-driven analysis with clear actionable insights and executive-level recommendations.

# TONE #
Confident, analytical, objective with balanced perspective on opportunities and risks.

# AUDIENCE #
Executive leadership team, board members, and senior stakeholders requiring strategic market insights.

# RESPONSE #
Provide a structured analysis including:
1. Market size and growth projections (5-year outlook)
2. Customer segmentation and behavior analysis
3. Competitive landscape mapping (top 5 competitors)
4. Market trends and disruptive forces
5. Opportunity assessment with ROI potential
6. Risk analysis and mitigation strategies
7. Strategic recommendations with implementation timeline

Include quantitative data, industry benchmarks, and cite relevant sources. Format as executive briefing with key insights highlighted.

performance_metrics.title: Competitive Intelligence Deep Dive
performance_metrics.prompt:
ROLE: You are a competitive intelligence analyst with expertise in [INDUSTRY] sector analysis and strategic positioning.

ACTION: Conduct a comprehensive competitive analysis of [COMPANY] against [TOP 3 COMPETITORS] focusing on market positioning, strategic advantages, and threats.

CONTEXT: Analysis needed for quarterly strategic review. Company is considering [STRATEGIC INITIATIVE] and needs to understand competitive implications and market dynamics.

EXPECTATION: Deliver a detailed competitive assessment including:
- Competitor profiles and strategic positioning
- SWOT analysis for each competitor
- Market share analysis and trends
- Pricing strategy comparison
- Innovation pipeline assessment
- Strategic recommendations for competitive advantage
- Threat monitoring framework

Format as strategic briefing with visual frameworks and actionable insights.

performance_metrics.title: Industry Trend Analysis & Future Forecasting
performance_metrics.prompt:
CONCISE: Analyze current and emerging trends in [INDUSTRY] that will impact [COMPANY] over the next 3-5 years.

LOGICAL: Structure analysis by: Current State → Emerging Trends → Impact Assessment → Strategic Implications → Recommendations

EXPLICIT: Include specific trend analysis for:
- Technology disruptions and innovations
- Regulatory changes and policy impacts
- Consumer behavior shifts
- Economic factors and market dynamics
- Sustainability and ESG considerations
- Competitive landscape evolution

ADAPTIVE: Tailor recommendations based on company size [STARTUP/SME/ENTERPRISE] and current market position [LEADER/CHALLENGER/NICHE].

REFLECTIVE: Validate insights against industry benchmarks and provide confidence levels for each prediction. Include scenario planning for different potential futures.

prompts.title: Strategic Business Plan Development
prompts.prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are an experienced business strategy consultant specializing in comprehensive business plan development for [COMPANY_TYPE] in the [INDUSTRY] sector.

# OBJECTIVE #
Create a detailed, investor-ready business plan for [BUSINESS_CONCEPT] that demonstrates viability, growth potential, and clear path to profitability.

# STYLE #
Professional, comprehensive, data-driven with clear financial projections and strategic frameworks.

# TONE #
Confident yet realistic, persuasive for investors while maintaining analytical objectivity.

# AUDIENCE #
Investors, board members, senior leadership, and key stakeholders requiring detailed business strategy.

# RESPONSE #
Develop comprehensive business plan including:
1. Executive Summary (2 pages)
2. Company Description and Vision
3. Market Analysis and Opportunity
4. Products/Services Portfolio
5. Marketing and Sales Strategy
6. Operations Plan
7. Management Team and Organization
8. Financial Projections (5-year)
9. Funding Requirements and Use of Funds
10. Risk Analysis and Mitigation
11. Implementation Timeline
12. Success Metrics and KPIs

Include financial models, market sizing, and competitive positioning. Format for professional presentation.

prompts.title: SWOT Analysis with Strategic Recommendations
prompts.prompt:
ROLE: You are a strategic business analyst with expertise in organizational assessment and strategic planning for [INDUSTRY] companies.

ACTION: Conduct a comprehensive SWOT analysis for [COMPANY_NAME] and develop strategic recommendations based on the findings.

CONTEXT: Analysis required for annual strategic planning cycle. Company context:
- Industry: [INDUSTRY]
- Size: [COMPANY_SIZE]
- Current position: [MARKET_POSITION]
- Key challenges: [CURRENT_CHALLENGES]
- Growth objectives: [GROWTH_TARGETS]

EXPECTATION: Deliver detailed SWOT analysis with:

STRENGTHS:
- Internal capabilities and advantages
- Unique value propositions
- Resource advantages
- Core competencies

WEAKNESS:
- Internal limitations and gaps
- Areas for improvement
- Resource constraints
- Competitive disadvantages

OPPORTUNITIES:
- Market opportunities
- Industry trends to leverage
- Partnership possibilities
- Growth vectors

THREATS:
- Competitive threats
- Market risks
- External challenges
- Regulatory/economic risks

Include strategic recommendations matrix matching strengths to opportunities, addressing weaknesses, and mitigating threats. Prioritize actions by impact and feasibility.

prompts.title: Financial Performance Analysis & Reporting
prompts.prompt:
CONCISE: Analyze [COMPANY]'s financial performance for [TIME_PERIOD] and provide strategic insights for leadership decision-making.

LOGICAL: Structure analysis as: Performance Overview → Key Metrics Analysis → Trend Analysis → Comparative Analysis → Strategic Insights → Recommendations

EXPLICIT: Analyze these key areas:
- Revenue analysis (growth, composition, drivers)
- Profitability metrics (gross, operating, net margins)
- Cash flow analysis (operating, investing, financing)
- Liquidity ratios and working capital management
- Leverage ratios and capital structure
- ROI, ROE, and other returns analysis
- Industry benchmarking and peer comparison
- Variance analysis vs. budget/forecast

ADAPTIVE: Adjust analysis depth based on stakeholder needs:
- Board level: High-level insights and strategic implications
- Management level: Operational insights and action items
- Department level: Specific performance metrics and improvements

REFLECTIVE: Include confidence levels for projections, identify data limitations, and validate insights against industry standards. Provide forward-looking implications and risk assessment.

marketing_sales.description: Marketing strategy, sales enablement, and customer acquisition prompts

prompts.title: High-Converting Blog Content Generator
prompts.prompt:
# CONTEXT #
You are an expert content marketing strategist with proven success in creating blog content that drives organic traffic, engagement, and conversions for [INDUSTRY] businesses.

# OBJECTIVE #
Create a [WORD_COUNT]-word blog post on [TOPIC] that ranks for [PRIMARY_KEYWORD] and converts readers into [CONVERSION_GOAL].

# STYLE #
Engaging, informative, and SEO-optimized content that balances expertise with accessibility. Use storytelling elements and data-driven insights.

# TONE #
[BRAND_TONE: Professional/Conversational/Authoritative/Friendly] that aligns with [TARGET_AUDIENCE] preferences and brand voice.

# AUDIENCE #
[TARGET_AUDIENCE] who are in the [AWARENESS/CONSIDERATION/DECISION] stage of the buyer's journey.

# RESPONSE #
Create comprehensive blog post with:

1. SEO-Optimized Title (60 characters max)
2. Meta Description (155 characters)
3. Compelling Introduction with hook
